bibl.title: The Medical and Surgical History of the War of the Rebellion. (1861-65.)

taxonomy.bibl: Medical and Surgical History of the War of the Rebellion

keywords.term: contusion of side of abdomen by tongue of wagon

revisionDesc.change: copied case from MSHWR, added proofing of transcription and encoding, identified keyword terms

body.p: The Museum contains no illustrations of this form of injury. Few details are given of the cases reported.:

CASE 102.—Reported by Surgeon D. W. Bliss, U. S. V.: Private H. H. Thayer, Co. H, 4th New York Heavy Artillery. Contusion, without external injury, of right side of abdomen, by the tongue of a wagon. Admitted into Army SquareArmory Square Hospital, January 5, 1864. Liver injured. Died, in three days, from peritonitis.
